item.title: Joint Economic Forecast 2020--2022
item.description:
The Joint Economic Forecast is prepared bi-annually in spring and in autumn on behalf of the Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy. The forecast is prepared by:

  • German Institute for Economic Research (DIW Berlin)
  • ifo Institute - Leibniz Institute for Economic Research at the University of Munich in cooperation with the KOF Swiss Economic Institute – ETH Zurich
  • Kiel Institute for the World Economy (IfW)
  • Halle Institute for Economic Research (IWH) – Member of the Leibniz Association
  • RWI – Leibniz Institute for Economic Research in cooperation with the Institute for Advanced Studies in Vienna

Project duration: 2020–2022

Funding body: Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology

item.title: Joint Economic Forecast 2016--2020
item.description:
The Joint Economic Forecast is prepared bi-annually in spring and in autumn on behalf of the Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy. The forecast is prepared by:

  • German Institute for Economic Research (DIW Berlin)
  • ifo Institute - Leibniz Institute for Economic Research at the University of Munich in cooperation with the KOF Swiss Economic Institute – ETH Zurich
  • Kiel Institute for the World Economy (IfW)

Funding body: Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology

item.title: RWI Business Cycle Forecasts
item.description:
The RWI – Leibniz Institute for Economic Research conducts a quarterly analysis of the business cycle developments in Germany and the world economy since 1954. This analysis includes a detailed forecast for the international economy bi-annually, in March and September.

We are a team of experts with years of experience (for some members - decades) and we use cutting edge methods to create a thorough economic forecast for Germany and over 30 other countries.

item.title: Scientific advisory for the Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology
item.description:
Scientific advisory for the German delegation from the Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology at the Output gap working group in the European Union.

Project duration: 2018–2019

Funding body: Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology

item.title: The macroeconomic effects of uncertainty
item.description: This is a collection of my papers on the effects of economic uncertainty in an international economic context. Most of my works estimate uncertainty empirically as some form of stochastic volatility.
